alert.note: Alert for Levy (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 1:18PM EDT until June 22 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Florida, including the following county, Levy. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williston, Chiefland, Bronson, Manattee Road, Andrews, Fowlers Bluff, East Bronson, Williston Highlands, Fanning Springs, Otter Creek and Manatee Springs State Park. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
